title: 109_hr5314
content: The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2006" extends the sunset date for education savings incentives to December 31, 2015. Distributions from education savings accounts for first home purchases are treated as qualified distributions. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2006" extends education savings incentives to 2015. Section 530 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include qualified expenses, such as education and first-time homebuyer expenses. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2006" extends education savings incentives to 2015. Section 530 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include qualified expenses for first-time homebuyers, effective for taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2006" allows rollovers from education savings accounts to Roth IRAs and renames Coverdell Education Savings Accounts as 401Kids Savings Accounts. These changes apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2006" renames Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to 401Kids Savings Accounts in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, with corresponding conforming amendments to various sections. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2006" renames Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to 401Kids Savings Accounts in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, with corresponding conforming amendments to various sections, including Section 4973(e) and Section 530. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2006" renames Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to 401Kids Savings Accounts in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, with corresponding conforming amendments to various sections, including Section 4973(e) and Section 530. The item in the table of contents for part VII of subchapter F of chapter 1 of such Code relating to section 530 is amended to read as follows: "Sec. 530. 401Kids savings accounts." The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
